string_data:
PRIMARY: Two Just Stop Oil activists disrupted the World Snooker Championship at Sheffield's Crucible Theatre, with Eddie Whittingham (26-year-old energy adviser) mounting a table and covering it with orange powder, while Margaret Reid (53-year-old ex-museum worker) attempted the same on another table. They caused Â£900 in criminal damage and received community orders with 300 hours of unpaid work between them, avoiding prison sentences.

SECONDARY: No secondary protest actions mentioned.

OTHER FOCAL: The court proceedings focused on the commercial impact beyond the physical damage, with the judge noting the international nature of the tournament and millions of viewers affected.

TONE: The article maintains a neutral tone, presenting both the activists' justifications and the court's criticism equally.
